**Digital Alternatives**: Utilize digital alternatives like Microsoft OneNote, Evernote, or Google Docs to keep your notes and work organized.
**Collaborate**: Reach out to colleagues or classmates and collaborate on projects, either in-person or virtually. This would help with task distribution and ensure that important work is completed.
**Paper-based Tools**: Use paper-based tools like a calendar, planner, or diary to keep track of deadlines and appointments.
**Read and Research**: Take advantage of the time to catch up on reading and research. This could help you gain new insights and ideas for future projects.
**Physical Exercise**: Incorporate physical exercise into your daily routine. Exercise has been shown to improve focus and productivity.
